reviewText: I ordered this movie as a gag because one of my friends cousin's is the host/narrator in this sex-ed film. However, on a more serious note, the practices and techniques in this film do actually give significant results if you take it seriously.

Simple and effective technique, tried the endless daily PC squeezing method  (as per Mantak Chia) and key sound method. They didn't work for me, but this technique works (with out the hundreds of  'daily'  PC squeezing exercises).
There is still a learning curve, but its not as steep as the two methods that I mentioned above.

Let me start by saying I bought this video purely for laughs. I never expected to actually learn anything from it.

  Turns out, it really is an excellent way to learn the basics of enjoying male multiple orgasms. And best of all, it's actually FUN to watch.

  Mr. Maxwell takes the basic teachings of Tantric and Taoist traditions and strips away all the boring dogma and unnecessary exercises and provides the viewer with a simple yet effective technique that actually works.

  There's no daily exercises or special muscle development required. And the practice itself couldn't be simpler.

  If you're looking for a spiritual journey into the world of exotic sexual practices - this ain't it.

  But if you're a guy who wants to skip all the long-winded dogma and just learn how to enjoy multiple orgasms this DVD is a great introduction to the basics.

"The Maxwell Multiple Climax" is a sex-ed film that teaches men how to achieve multiple orgasms. Shot in a mod multimedia style (with a nod to Russ Meyer and the free love era), it's funny too, with great eye candy and retro animation.  Not graphic, but definitely for adults.

At first I wasn't sure how serious to take it, but I learned a lot.  If you thought the Tantra was too complex and time-consuming to consider, Maxwell teaches a step-by-step method to unlock the mysteries of Kama Sutra for the regular Joe.

A real surprise!
